channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: After 100 Years, Britain’s Two-Party Political System May Be Crumbling
item.description: Nigel Farage’s right-wing populist party, Reform U.K., is presenting a serious challenge to the governing Labour Party and to the opposition Conservat...

item.title: Trump’s Tariffs Create Fear and Uncertainty at Vietnam’s Factories
item.description: The threat of 46 percent levies, among the highest for any country, is rattling Vietnam’s factory managers and workers, as well as thousands of export...

item.title: Voters Approve Incorporation of SpaceX Hub as Starbase, Texas
item.description: A South Texas community, mostly made up of SpaceX employees, voted 212 to 6 in favor of establishing a new city called Starbase.

item.title: One Moment That Foretold It All
item.description: The most consequential day of Donald Trump’s second term came before it even began.

item.title: ‘People Who Are Salaried Are Crying’: Taxes on Workers Add to Debt Misery
item.description: Increased payroll taxes are one element of a desperate bid in Kenya to keep the government running and pay off the country’s foreign creditors.

item.title: Australia’s Prime Minister Wins Second Term
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese of Australia won in a resounding defeat of the conservative opposition led by Peter Dutton.

item.title: After 100 Years, Britain’s Two-Party Political System May Be Crumbling
item.description: Nigel Farage’s right-wing populist party, Reform U.K., is presenting a serious challenge to the governing Labour Party and to the opposition Conservat...

item.title: Singapore’s Election Deals a Setback to a Fledgling Opposition
item.description: The People’s Action Party continued its six-decade reign, as was widely expected. But many had anticipated it to lose more ground to the opposition.

item.title: Warren Buffett’s best and worst investments in his 60 years as Berkshire Hathaway CEO
item.description: Buffett said that some of his worst mistakes over the years were the investments and deals that he didn’t make.

item.title: Warren Buffett says Greg Abel should take over as Berkshire Hathaway CEO by year’s end
item.description: "I think they'll be unanimously in favor of it, and that would mean that at year-end Greg would be the chief executive officer of Berkshire and I woul...

item.title: Jamie Dimon says Buffett ‘represents everything that is good about American capitalism’ as Tim Cook praises him and successor Abel
item.description: Berkshire Hathaway CEO Warren Buffett announced Saturday that he plans to step down by the end of the year.

item.title: Shell is studying merits of BP deal as rival’s stock slumps
item.description: The companies were once close rivals — with a similar size, reach and global clout — but their paths have diverged in recent years.

item.title: Warren Buffett has this advice for young investors—and it has nothing to do with where they should put their money
item.description: "You're going to have your life progress in the general direction of the people that you work with, that you admire, that become your friends."

item.title: Poised to Expand Gaza Offensive, Israel Calls Up Thousands of Reserve Soldiers
item.description: The mobilization could indicate that Israel is preparing to shift its tactics in its fight against Hamas.

item.title: These Contentious Issues Could Determine Who Becomes the Next Pope
item.description: As cardinals gather to elect Pope Francis’ successor, they are facing debates over whether the church most needs change or constancy.
